title: Chickasaw National Recreation Area: Photo Gallery
body: Photo Gallery       It has been said that a picture is worth a thousand words. The following photograph albums explore some of the many natural and cultural resources which make Chickasaw National Recreation Area unique.  Â                 The Platt Historic District   21 Photos  Present-day photographs showing the buildings, springs, and landscape features of the former Platt National Park.          The Lincoln Bridge   11 Photos            The Junior Ranger Station   8 Photos              Summer of Floods - 2007   2 Photos  Photographs taken by park staff showing high lake levels during the summer of 2007.          Snow and Ice   10 Photos  The winter season is generally mild at Chickasaw National Recreation Area, yet occasional snowfalls occur, highlighting the winter season and bringing a temporary change to the landscape.          1950s Views of Platt National Park   17 Photos  Color photographs taken by park staff in the 1950s            Views of Chickasaw NRA   37 Photos  Miscellaneous pictures taken at various park locations.          Trail building workshop; March 2010   20 Photos  Photographs taken during the trail-building workshop led by the International Mountain Biking Association's Trail Care Crew on Saturday, March 6, 2010          1930s Blueprints   18 Photos  Plans produced for improvements in Platt National Park built by the Civilian Conservation Corps between 1933-40.
